remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> must have a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> associated with it. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> can then write out the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> to an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>. The only way to associate a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> is by using this constructor.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The RSS 2.0 and Atom 1.0 specifications allow you to add custom element extensions to a syndication feed. This method allows you to read in these element extensions from an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is protected and cannot be called from user code. To associate a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter>, either create a new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> instance and pass the constructor a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance or load a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter> by calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemFormatter.ReadFrom%28System.Xml.XmlReader%29>.
